Line 32: Line 32:
== Install ==
== Install ==
â
Like many other popular Linux distributions, Sabayon Linux is distributed as a [[LiveDistro]] with options to install to the hard disk. The [[Anaconda (installer)|Anaconda installer]] is currently used for the installation, although the Gentoo Linux Installer was used in the past. The installation process is designed to be much simpler than a typical Gentoo install, which requires more extensive knowledge of the operating system.
+
Like many other popular Linux distributions, Sabayon Linux is distributed as a [[Live Distro]] with options to install to the hard disk. The [[Anaconda (installer)|Anaconda installer]] is currently used for the installation, although the Gentoo Linux Installer was used in the past. The installation process is designed to be much simpler than a typical Gentoo install, which requires more extensive knowledge of the operating system.
Reviews of the installation process are mixed. Some users report a simple half-hour installation <ref>{{cite web|url=http://techgage.com/article/sabayonlinux_33/2 |title=Sabayon Linux 3.3 |accessdate=2008-06-29 |last=Williams |first=Rob |date=2007-03-22 |work=Techgage }}</ref>, while others report a processor intensive 1 hour+ installation<ref>{{cite web|url=http://simplyjat.blogspot.com/2007/08/sabayon-linux-34-review.html |title=Sabayon Linux 3.4 Review |accessdate=2008-06-29 |date=2007-08-05 }}</ref>. However, this can be largely dependent on factors such as hardware capabilities and how many of the numerous optional applications are selected during the installation process.
Reviews of the installation process are mixed. Some users report a simple half-hour installation <ref>{{cite web|url=http://techgage.com/article/sabayonlinux_33/2 |title=Sabayon Linux 3.3 |accessdate=2008-06-29 |last=Williams |first=Rob |date=2007-03-22 |work=Techgage }}</ref>, while others report a processor intensive 1 hour+ installation<ref>{{cite web|url=http://simplyjat.blogspot.com/2007/08/sabayon-linux-34-review.html |title=Sabayon Linux 3.4 Review |accessdate=2008-06-29 |date=2007-08-05 }}</ref>. However, this can be largely dependent on factors such as hardware capabilities and how many of the numerous optional applications are selected during the installation process.
